snippet: A new set of fossils, ranging from four million to six million years old, and thought to be the oldest ever found, belonged to a previously unknown species.
abstract: Jack Tseng study in Proceedings of the Royal Society B: Biological Sciences reports discovery of set of big-cat fossils thought to be oldest ever found and belonging to previously unknown species known as Pantherine blytheae; fossils may help solve longstanding mystery about origins of big cats.
lead_paragraph: A new set of fossils, ranging from four million to six million years old, and thought to be the oldest ever found, belonged to a previously unknown species.

headline.print_headline: Fossils: Clues to the Origins of Big Cats
headline.main: Clues to the Origins of Big Cats

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
